content:
hello @simulacrum / @Pietro Albini

during the T-compiler meeting we noticed that unresolved regressions should be pushed to the next release channel (nightly -> beta and beta -> stable). Do we have a process / TODO list when the release tagging happens (like it is today) where these "actions" are listed and executed?
I've checked the forge.rlo though I don't know if it's the right place for this.
(I mean in case, if needed, I can take care of it by scheduling a reminder for me to run filtered search and relabel them)
No, there's no current such process. I suspect that it would be advantageous to just drop the -to-beta/-to-nightly labels in favor of milestoning appropriately, IMO.
(This proposal has been circulated a number of times in various forms, just never followed through)

ok, understood, thanks :thumbs_up:
I'll be around at the next release cycle (in January) and check these labels before / right after the release
There are several different discussions that have happened of this recently. Let me link them.

ugh, also one where I was a participant.
Anyway, thanks for the links @inquisitivecrystal , I hope I now have a clearer picture and won't go around asking the same questions over and over :D
